title: The British Empire  - A Historical Encyclopedia [2 vols](gnv64)
description: The British Empire : A Historical Encyclopedia [2 Volumes] by Mark Doyle ABC-CLIO | June 2018 | ISBN-10: 1440841977 | 706 Pages | PDF | 44.15 MB An essential starting point for anyone wanting to learn about life in the largest empire in history, this two-volume work encapsulates the imperial experience from the 16th–21st centuries. • Provides primary sources that give voice to the people who ran, opposed, and were subjects of the British Empire • Consolidates the most up-to-date research from established and emerging scholars in the field in many countries and at many institutions • Includes a detailed introduction that succinctly puts the British Empire into historical context • Offers a chronology of events and episodes important to both the rise and fall of the British Empire • Provides a broad range of perspectives that focus not only on the white men who controlled the British Empire but also on the many people?such as women, indigenous peoples, poor Europeans, and Christian missionaries?who formed it • Avoids simplistic assessments of British imperialism as merely "good" or "bad," emanating an objectivity that enables readers to develop their own ideas about the nature of the empire About the Author https://i.postimg.cc/wTXpwyW1/Mark_Doyle.jpg Mark Doyle, PhD, is associate professor of history at Middle Tennessee State University. He is the author of Communal Violence in the British Empire: Disturbing the Pax Mark Doyle received a Ph.D. in Irish and British History from Boston College in 2006. He has held fellowships at the University of Pennsylvania and Amherst College and is currently Associate Professor of British History at Middle Tennessee State University. He lives in Nashville, TN, with his wife and two daughters. CONTENTS VOLUME 1 Preface xiii Introduction xv Chronology xxvii Government and Politics 1 Organization and Administration 75 Groups and Organizations 141 Individuals 213 VOLUME 2 Key Events 1 Military 75 Objects and Artifacts 151 Key Places 197 Primary Documents 249 Appendix A: British Sovereigns, 1509–Present 331 Appendix B: British Prime Ministers 333 Bibliography 335 Editor and Contributors 339 Index 347 https://i.postimg.cc/W15xyM01/The_British_Empire_-_A_Historical_Encyclopedia.jpg
